name: symantec-dlp
label: Symantec DLP
description: Symantec DLP provide actions like get incident attachments, get incident details, get incident status, update incident etc.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.description: IP or URL of the Symantec DLP server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.name: server_url

fields.title: Username
fields.description: Username to access the Symantec DLP server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.name: username

fields.title: Password
fields.description: Password to access the Symantec DLP server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.name: password

fields.title: Protocol
fields.description: Protocol used to remotely connect to the Symantec DLP server. Choose between http or https.By default, https is used
fields.name: protocol

fields.title: Port
fields.description: Port number used to connect to the Symantec DLP server. default, this is set to 8443.
fields.name: port

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.By default, this option is set as True.
fields.name: verify_ssl

operations.title: Get Incident Status
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all incident status values available on the Symantec DLP server.

operations.title: Get Incident Attachments
operations.description: Retrieves additional components of the message that generated an incident, such as the message header, body, and binary attachments, based on the Symantec DLP incident ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident Long ID
parameters.description: Unique Symantec DLP incident ID whose associated attachments such as message headers etc you want to retrieve from Symantec DLP.
parameters.tooltip: Incident ID to get its attachment
parameters.name: incident_long_id

parameters.title: Include All Components
parameters.description: If you select this check box, then the Web Service will include all the message components (for example, headers and file attachments) in the response document retrieved from Symantec DLP.
parameters.tooltip: Whether the Web Service should include all message components (for example, headers and file attachments) in the response document.
parameters.name: includeAllComponents

parameters.title: Include Original Message
parameters.description: If you select this check box, then the Web Service will include the original message in the response document retrieved from Symantec DLP.
parameters.tooltip: Whether the Web Service should include the original message in the response document.
parameters.name: includeOriginalMessage

operations.title: Get Incidents IDs
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all available incidents IDs stored in the Report ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident Report ID
parameters.description: ID of the saved report that you want to execute on the Enforce Server. You must have created this report using the Enforce Server administration console before executing the Web Service call.The incidents are retrieved using this Report ID.
parameters.name: report_id

parameters.title: Report Creation Date
parameters.description: Constrains the list of returned incident IDs to include only those Symantec DLP incidents that were created after the date you specify, in the YYYY-MM-DD format, in this parameter.If you do not specify any date then this operation will not retrieve any reports.
parameters.name: creation_date_greater_then

operations.title: Get Incident Details
operations.description: Retrieves details of a single Symantec DLP incident, based on the Symantec DLP incident ID that you have specified

parameters.title: Incident Long ID
parameters.description: Unique ID of the Symantec DLP incident for which you want to retrieve details.
parameters.name: incident_long_id

parameters.title: Include Violations
parameters.description: (Optional) Select this parameter to include policy violation data, for the incident you have specified using the Incident ID, along with the basic incident details.
parameters.name: include_violations

parameters.title: Include History
parameters.description: (Optional) Select this parameter to include historical information, for the incident you have specified using the Incident ID, along with the basic incident details.
parameters.name: include_history

operations.title: Get Custom Attributes
operations.description: Retrieves details of custom attribute values available on the Symantec DLP server.

operations.title: Get Incident Violations
operations.description: Retrieves details of violations associated with the specified incident ID, based on the Symantec DLP incident ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident Long ID
parameters.description: Unique ID of the Symantec DLP incident for which you want to retrieve violation details.
parameters.name: incident_long_id

parameters.title: Include Image Violations
parameters.description: (Optional) Select this parameter to include image violation data, for the incident you have specified using the Incident ID, along with the basic incident details.
parameters.name: include_image_violations

operations.title: Update Incident
operations.description: Updates an incident record on the Symantec DLP server, based on the incident ID and other parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident Long ID
parameters.description: Unique ID of the Symantec DLP incident that you want to update.
parameters.name: incident_long_id

parameters.title: Incident Severity
parameters.description: (Optional) Severity of the incident that you want to update.Choose between High, Medium, Low, and Info.
parameters.name: severity

parameters.title: Incident Status
parameters.description: (Optional) Status Value of the incident that you want to update.Incident status values are defined using the Enforce Server administration console.
parameters.name: status

parameters.title: Add Notes
parameters.description: (Optional)Select this opton if you want to add notes to incident
parameters.name: add_notes

true.title: Note Creation Date
true.description: Time the note was added to the incident that you want to update.
true.name: note_creation_date

true.title: Note Text
true.description: Content of the note that you want to add to the incident that you want to update.
true.tooltip: Note creation date must be mentioned for adding Note
true.name: note

parameters.title: Remediation Status
parameters.description: (Optional) Remediation status of the incident that you want to update.Remediation status is a static list that is present in Symantec DLP and its values are such as Blocked, Passed, Content_Removed, etc.
parameters.name: remediation_status

parameters.title: Remediation Location
parameters.description: (Optional) Remediation location of the incident that you want to update.You can define the values of the Remediation location.
parameters.name: remediation_location

parameters.title: Custom Attributes
parameters.description: (Optional)Name, Value of custom attribute(s) associated with the incident that you want to update.. E.g {"attributename1": "value1", "attributename2": "value2"}
parameters.name: custom_attrib_value

operations.title: Download EML File
operations.description: Downloads an eml file from the Symantec DLP server, based on the Symantec DLP incident ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident Long ID
parameters.description: Unique Symantec DLP incident ID whose associated eml file you want to retrieve from Symantec DLP.
parameters.tooltip: Incident ID to get its original msg eml
parameters.name: incident_long_id

parameters.title: Save File
parameters.tooltip: Save the email as a file in the Attachment module.
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to True(default) to save the downloaded eml file as a file in the "Attachment" module in FortiSOARâ„¢.
parameters.name: save_as_attachment

operations.title: Get Sender/Recipient Pattern
operations.description: Get the sender/recipient pattern's details of specified pattern.

parameters.title: Sender/Recipient Pattern
parameters.description: Select the rule type from the Sender or Recipient.
parameters.name: rule_type

parameters.title: Pattern Name
parameters.description: Specify the pattern name which needs to be fetched.
parameters.name: pattern_name
parameters.placeholder: The name that you specify here must match exactly.

operations.title: Update Sender/Recipient Pattern
operations.description: Updates the recipient pattern with specified email address, IP address, URL domains.

parameters.title: Sender/Recipient Pattern
parameters.description: Select the rule type form the Sender or Recipient.
parameters.name: rule_type

Recipient.title: Recipient Pattern Name
Recipient.description: Specify the recipient pattern name which needs to be updated.
Recipient.name: pattern_name
Recipient.placeholder: The name that you specify here must match exactly.

Recipient.title: Email Addresses
Recipient.description: Specify the comma separated values of email addresses which needs to be add/delete in Recipient Pattern.
Recipient.name: emails

Recipient.title: IP Addresses
Recipient.description: Specify the comma separated values of IP addresses which needs to be add/delete in Recipient Pattern.
Recipient.name: ips

Recipient.title: URL Domains
Recipient.description: Specify the comma separated values of URL domains which needs to be add/delete in Recipient Pattern.
Recipient.name: urls

Sender.title: Sender Pattern Name
Sender.description: Specify the name of the sender pattern which needs to be updated.
Sender.name: pattern_name
Sender.placeholder: The name that you specify here must match exactly.

Sender.title: User Patterns
Sender.description: Specify the comma separated values of email address which needs to be add/delete in Sender Pattern.
Sender.name: emails
Sender.placeholder: e.g. company.com, john.smith@business.com, sample.company.com, jsmith, jsmith@company*

Sender.title: IP Addresses
Sender.description: Specify the comma separated values of IP addresses which needs to be add/delete in Sender Pattern.
Sender.name: ips

parameters.title: Add/Delete the Items
parameters.description: Uncheck to delete the items from the sender/recipient pattern rule.By default set to true which will add the items in the pattern rule.
parameters.name: add_items
parameters.tooltip: Uncheck to delete the items from the pattern rule.
